TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Thanks for the replies on about everything, the only thing I really want to know is, well, would you work on a ksp mod that includes smaller than usuall spacecraft parts and probes (i.e. smaller than 0.625 meters, and possibly 0.35 meters).

Thank you for responding

Astrofox

I think the tweakscale issue(if there is a tweakscale issue) is that Tantares had a config way back before the TKS. This config may be broken by the remodel. (Again, this is purely an uninformed hypothesis)

EDIT: also, is there still a chance at seeing CARV and/or alternate Fuji OMs?

Yeah, the Tweakscale config is very-very old. I think it will be good to contact the mod author to update or delete it. I just irrationally, well, don't like that mod and try not to use it if possible, once again, I don't know why, maybe because of the annoying SUDDEN SIZE CHANGES and some really dated configs. Anyway, something should be done about the config, since people use it.

So, I tried to make the L-RCS Stability Block (RCS assembly for the LK lander) into a docking port by adding:

MODULE
{
    name = ModuleDockingNode
    referenceAttachNode = top
    nodeType = size0    
}

to the config, and while it appears to have docking properties in the VAB (tweakable everything gives me all the standard "sliders" and so forth) it does NOT have any docking port properties in flight (preassembled has no "decouple node" button, and it can't be "docked" with)

So this leads me to wonder, what is required to make a part a docking port? I assume some sort of node or attribute wasn't included in Unity when it was made into a part...

Edited January 22, 2015 by tg626

The new LOK looks amazing! Can't wait for the release.

Are you planning on releasing the soyuz updates as it's own update, or waiting for the LK and/or other stuff too before making it an "official" release?
Beale, just to be clear, the new KURS T-CD01 dish isn't replacing the old trusty TST CD-01, right? I use that little guy on everything...

Like the final soyuz art: a fine balance of greeble and stock-a-like.

Many thanks

Cool - I was close...

http://i.imgur.com/OMpN8CC.png

I used that ugly stock Decoupler because funds - and I needed to ditch the SM for reentry while keeping the Heatshield attached O_O;

Did you include a Heatshield? I didn't see one...

Nevermind, found it...

The heatshield includes a decoupler or it should do...

I think the tweakscale issue(if there is a tweakscale issue) is that Tantares had a config way back before the TKS. This config may be broken by the remodel. (Again, this is purely an uninformed hypothesis)

EDIT: also, is there still a chance at seeing CARV and/or alternate Fuji OMs?

Carv and Fuji stuff: Another victim of 'ooh, I'm doing this shiny new stuff now'

Personally, I will say the PPTS is not so far away, will fill the role of Carv.

Tried Mk3 cootie in 0.25, looks (and weights, and that is so goddamn important for me!) great so far.Solar panels on high air friction just disappears, is that how they supposed to be (yeah, I used hack-gravity-float-nears-KSC-trick for testing)?

Odd issue, I haven't tested it, so I cannot say for sure. The Solar panels use a new method of pivoting, so there could be problems,

Just curious, is there a HotRockets config for this?

Not yet, I've been looking into smokescreen stuff

Thanks for the replies on about everything, the only thing I really want to know is, well, would you work on a ksp mod that includes smaller than usuall spacecraft parts and probes (i.e. smaller than 0.625 meters, and possibly 0.35 meters).

Thank you for responding

Astrofox

0.35 meters, I doubt it, sorry.

Have you checked out RoverDude's sounding rockets? Provides exactly that size.

Yeah, the Tweakscale config is very-very old. I think it will be good to contact the mod author to update or delete it. I just irrationally, well, don't like that mod and try not to use it if possible, once again, I don't know why, maybe because of the annoying SUDDEN SIZE CHANGES and some really dated configs. Anyway, something should be done about the config, since people use it.

I had no idea there was a tantares specific config! I'll look into it

So, I tried to make the L-RCS Stability Block (RCS assembly for the LK lander) into a docking port by adding:

MODULE
{
    name = ModuleDockingNode
    referenceAttachNode = top
    nodeType = size0    
}

to the config, and while it appears to have docking properties in the VAB (tweakable everything gives me all the standard "sliders" and so forth) it does NOT have any docking port properties in flight (preassembled has no "decouple node" button, and it can't be "docked" with)

So this leads me to wonder, what is required to make a part a docking port? I assume some sort of node or attribute wasn't included in Unity when it was made into a part...

A solid effort my friend but unfortunately it requires a "docvkingNode" transform in unity. The new LK will have this.

The new LOK looks amazing! Can't wait for the release.

Are you planning on releasing the soyuz updates as it's own update, or waiting for the LK and/or other stuff too before making it an "official" release?

Many thanks!

I plan release when TKS is done. LK to follow soon after.

Beale, just to be clear, the new KURS T-CD01 dish isn't replacing the old trusty TST CD-01, right? I use that little guy on everything...

It is replacing it!

But, being mainly the same size and shape. I do not see compat. Issues
FYI, there's also a Tantares config bundled with RealChute that could use some love as well.

A solid effort my friend but unfortunately it requires a "docvkingNode" transform in unity. The new LK will have this.

The one bundled with Tantares should override that config, so I don't think there is a problem. Though, I might be wrong.

I have seen a few posts about the new Soyuz update breaking compatibility. What changed?

I have seen a few posts about the new Soyuz update breaking compatibility. What changed?

The vast majority of parts have different sizes.

Though no parts are missing, there may be some risk in loading existing ships, I.E some nodes have changed position.
Soyuz-A? That's great!

So, I have improved my R-7 service towers. They now include floodlights and a spacecraft access arm for crewed missions.

This would probably cause the rocket to heat up and burst into flames in real life.
